wikipedia_page.main: Emily Smith is an English children's writer. Her books are aimed at young readers, mainly writing for Young Corgi Books (a Transworld Publishers imprint) and Orchard Books. Her first children's book, Astrid, the au pair from Outer Space won the Silver medal in the 6-8 age group, at the Nestlé Smarties Book Prize 1999. The Shrimp won the 6-8 age group Nestlé Smarties Book Prize Gold medal in 2000.

response: * 6–8 years: The Shrimp by Emily Smith (Young Corgi), illus. Wendy Smith
::* 6–8 years: Astrid, the Au Pair from Outer Space by Emily Smith (Corgi), illus. Tim Archbold
The Shrimp is a children's novel by Emily Smith. It won the 2001 Gold Award in 6–8 years category of the Nestlé Smarties Book Prize. It is a part of the Young Corgi series.
*Emily Smith (field hockey) (born 1992), Australian field hockey player
*Emily Smith, 1st Viscountess Hambleden (died 1913), wife of William Henry Smith
